TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
Are you ever going to make a 3 crewed Soyuz? PS: Are eventually going to make IVA's for all crewed modules?

they've been over this time and time again. three kerbals simply wouldn't fit in a pod that small.
The new Soyuz LES looks great, but it could go without the yellow stripes.

Probably not, sorry. It would be a little too bloaty IMO

They're being removed, yup.

As is the V-2, that is now gone.

Why are you getting rid of the V-2? Its useful in so many contexts, especially early game, where most of my rockets are derived from it. I humbly ask that you reconsider it's removal.

Why are you getting rid of the V-2? Its useful in so many contexts, especially early game, where most of my rockets are derived from it. I humbly ask that you reconsider it's removal.

It's part of his new spinoff early-rocketry style mod now!

Those verniers look amazing with RD-107 by the way Beale <3

Why are you getting rid of the V-2? Its useful in so many contexts, especially early game, where most of my rockets are derived from it. I humbly ask that you reconsider it's removal.
Edited September 8, 2015 by Beale

Ah, nice! I tried out the new R-7 for a good 5 or 10 minutes this morning, but I noticed it doesn't do the Korolev Cross like it used to.

I don't like having to use stock decouplers for the boosters.

Mainly I want to do away with the V-2 as I am sick of the constant weird requests for nÃÂ°zi planes, tanks, etc.

Probably should not have made it in the first place.

Ah. So basically the same craft, but without the obvious .... connotations. The Bumper/R1 seem like a better choice anyways - more interesting in terms of rocket development.

I had a chance to try it out over my lunch break, and sure enough - having flipping issues with the new R-7. I'll post a craft, and maybe a youtube, when I get home.

Very basic "sputnik" style R-7 without upper stage, 12 vernier config, one small fin (the small stock static one) on each booster.

Climb to 8000 meters, start to very slowly and gently edge the nose east

Within seconds, the entire rocket flips and won't recover, flying bottom-first unable to flip back around.

I tried a second time and covered the whole rocket with standard canards and RCS, and still had trouble but was able to at least get into orbit without flipping over.

Also found that the stock radial decouplers are having trouble ejecting the booster tanks with enough force to eject clear of the center stage/tank to avoid collisions.

That's really strange. I tried two different launcher configurations (Vostok-K and Soyuz-FG), and they both performed beautifully. Are you throttling back at all to account for the dynamic pressure on the vehicle? Going full-throttle through the entire ascent leaves you almost no latitude with the angle of attack and will most assuredly send your booster flipping.

Ah, nice! I tried out the new R-7 for a good 5 or 10 minutes this morning, but I noticed it doesn't do the Korolev Cross like it used to.

I don't like having to use stock decouplers for the boosters.

Ven's Stock Revamp has a sep motor called a "Snub-O-Tron", which you can place facing the main tank near the tip of each outboard tank. The Korolev Cross is restored!

Edited September 8, 2015 by Jack Wolfe
